data.title: You get what you pay for
data.text:
Goods-Bed was great, hot hot water

Bads - breakfast left a lot to be desired, one of two elevators did not work, built on the cheap.  Location was okay. We used Uber all the time, so was no problem. Parking is $34.00 per day with in and out service. Staff was okay

data.title: Spacious clean updated rooms, nice complimentary breakfast, good location
data.text: This hotel offers a double king room option with plenty of space. Recently renovated and updated-this is a fair value and decent location. Enjoyed our stay, felt safe, and great beds. Bar/restaurant in hotel and also GREAT dining options within short walking distance.

data.title: Promises promises
data.text:
We were greeted with a warm and welcoming front desk.  The hotel smelled of new! The hotel is located off beaten path of canal and Bourbon Streets, in an area of rebirth.  We chatted with the front desk asking about a good steak place (she led us to a non-steak place), we also asked her for a 3a wake up call to get to our flight, she offered to have a small care package of fruit and a muffin for our early departure.  She also asked if we would need a cab at that time we said yes 4a.  We thought what awesome service!  BUT:
. No wake up at 3a
. No care package
. No cab 

For a new hotel they need to make sure they keep their promises...this isn't growing pains this is an issue that needs addressing.

data.title: Great Stay Great Location
data.text:
We stayed here just 2 weeks after it opened.  There were some hiccups but they were easily overlooked because the staff was prompt in rectifying problems.  The staff is still new so they are still establishing a team report but I have nothing but positive things to say about the way we were treated.  I understand there were some problems at the hotel prior to our stay but our experience was all positive.
The location is very close to all attractions and restaurants.  The streetcar is around the corner and the supermarket is down the street.  The decor is pleasant and the room was quiet and appointed with a micro and fridge. Breakfast was standard hotel fare and included in the rate.
All things considered this was a very good stay at a reasonable rate.

data.title: New Orleans stay
data.text: The building is newly remodeled. Our room has modern décor, and the exposed beams and tall ceilings were nice touches. The entrance is nice, and the staff were helpful.  The breakfast each day was as expected. There is no onsite parking, but there is a new parking garage just around the corner that is $20 per day.  I recommend it over use of the valet. It is about a 5 block walk to Bourbon Street, and there are plenty of nearby restaurants. I had to ask for wash clothes twice because the cleaning staff did not leave any.  However they brought them to me each time.

data.title: Fall Break
data.text: Spent three nights at this new hotel.  Breakfast every morning was good.  My two young boys love the make your own waffles.  We had a corner room with two king beds.  Very nice.  Could see a lot of the city from our 7th floor view.  We enjoyed staying at this hotel for our first experience to NOLA!

data.title: Reunion/trip with friends
data.text: I've stayed in a lot of fairfield inn properties and I've never seen a location as beautiful as this one.  The televisions are complete with netflix and endless shows to watch, lamps with USB plug ins for the many devices we had with us, and really comfortable beds for a good night sleep. The staff is friendly and helpful. The free breakfast had many options to choose from. I saw the general manager of the hotel helping serve and prepare breakfast! Great hospitality from all employees I encountered here. Very clean.  I will definitely be back and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to new Orleans.  It's within walking distance to Bourbon street and all of the delicious restaurants we ate at. I loved this hotel!

data.title: Why put us in a room that isn't ready to house guests?
data.text:
We stayed at this hotel from 10/21-10/24. It is a new hotel. The employees were responsive to our many basic requests. 

When we checked in and got to our room, 2 King bed room on the 4th floor, we put our suitcases in the corner and wanted a place to sit and rest. Unfortunately there were no chairs to sit on. There was a dresser and 2 beds. We called down and were told that they would bring up 2 chairs. There were 3 of us in the room. They told us the desk didn't fit in the room so they had to make a custom desk and it wasn't ready yet. Why put us in that room if it wasn't ready?  The entire stay our microwave didn't function. The 3rd evening we were not given wash cloths. We called down and they brought some to us.  The room was very narrow. 

It was very noisy in the area, lots of construction going on and consequently the rooms were very noisy. 

There are many other places to stay in the area. Choose them.

data.title: Reunion Stay
data.text: Our group of former and retired military members stayed at this hotel from 9 Oct 16 to 14 Oct 16 for a 61st reunion.  The average age of the group is 79.  The service provided by Joshua Simms, Tanay Sanchell, and Devin Degruy was above anything we had anticipated.  This hotel just recently opened and there were some minor issues with a few rooms which were handled immediately.  These three individuals provided us with information on local restaurants, trolley schedules and Uber drivers.  They never once appeared to be annoyed by our requests. This reunion was planned on line and without their assistance may not have been as successful as it was. Additional staff members, breakfast support staff and maintenance employees also made this stay exceptional.   Ms Pat Coulter, the manager, was very visible every day, ensuring we had everything we needed.  It is evident from attitudes and performance that all these employees enjoy their work which reflects on management and the organization.  Thank you Marriott for having such a well trained staff.

data.title: Newly Renovated!
data.text: Everything is fresh at this moderately priced CBD hotel as a complete remodeling was finished at the end of September 2016 .  It's in a very appealing historic type building . Some of front desk staff were just okay and seemed inexperienced . Complimentary breakfast was fine  and typical for this type of hotel .  There is a bar with light fare - our bartender was good , friendly and very accommodating.   Valet service was prompt !  Location was good and seemed to be about .7 miles from most tourist type areas .  Some minor issues but overall good experience .

data.title: Average, clean, great rates with breakfast
data.text: It's an old building recently renovated. Everything in rooms and lobby has been updated- the "old" carpet mentioned by another reviewer is actually new, trendy pattern that looks worn.  Didn't notice any bad smell mentioned by another reviewer, and I'm usually sensitive to those kind of things. A/C worked great for us. Elevators are small and old but worked. Free breakfast was adequate but needed attention to restocking items more often. Small refrigerator and microwave in spacious room with 1 King bed. Staff was helpful. Easy walk to Canal St. and French Quarter, coffee shop & restaurants within a block.

data.title: Great Location and First Rate Hospitality
data.text:
The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and management is accommodating. 

On the first morning of our stay, the fire alarm sounded -- we found out later that it was due to an issue with an elevator motor, ultimately rendering one of the two elevators out-of-service for the remainder of our stay. We all filed out of the building while management and the fire department made sure all guests were out and okay. That very afternoon, the hotel management delivered letters and coupons for complimentary appetizers to each of the guests as a token of apology for any inconvenience it might have caused us. I thought this was a super classy gesture.

Special shout out to Josh at the front desk who went way above and beyond in helping us out.

Breakfast was great, so was the gym. Location is great too -- near the French Quarter, but on a quieter side of town. Will definitely stay here again.

data.title: Does not appear to be "new"
data.text: We were surprised that this "new" Fairfield  had such a bad smell when we walked in. Must just be the area? We stayed 3 nights and the smell greeted you each time you walked in. We were on the 7th floor and only one of the two elevators worked during our stay. The carpet in the halls seemed to be really worn out, but the room was clean and nice, it was quite noisy with people's doors slamming all night the first night, but it is in the heart of New Orleans. We had trouble getting the AC to work well. Breakfast was good. People were nice.

data.title: Stay away!!!
data.text: The rooms have been updated but the rest is old, old, old and tired.  The elevators, hall carpet, hallways are so outdated.  The lobby was small and strange.The whole place, rooms and public areas smelled old.  The location was OK.  We ended up not staying the night and moved to another hotel.  The people at the hotel were nice.  I felt bad leaving.

data.title: Opened too soon
data.text: Stayed at this location for two nights. Above arrival had a hard time unloading luggage since it was busy street and no where to park. Once we had luggage unloaded we were then confronted with only one operational elevator which bearly fit the luggage cart with two passengers. Upon checkout we were then confronted with BOTH elevators being  of out of order and we had to carry multiple luggage down four flights of stairs.  Not good for two senior citizens. Rooms were nice but there was a rather large nite light in the vanity mirror near the bedroom which could not be shut off and we had to stack items to try to block light that projected into sleeping area. Management should have gotten this hotel 100 percent operational before allowing customers to occupy.

owner_response.author: Pat C, General Manager at Fairfield Inn & Suites New Orleans Downtown/French Quarter Area, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for choosing the Fairfield Inn and Suites for your recent stay. Please accept my apologies for the elevators not working properly.  We are addressing this issue.  I am sorry for the frustration that this caused you.
Warm Regards,
Pat
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New hotel but too pricey for its location and service.
data.text: Hotel just opened.  Nice looking.  So so location...far from anything.  Problem is service is not yet up to par.  Housekeeping did not come to clean the room until the 3rd day when we complained and asked for bath towels, soap and shampoo.  Disappointing for a Marriott hotel.

owner_response.author: Pat C, General Manager at Fairfield Inn & Suites New Orleans Downtown/French Quarter Area, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello,
Thank you for staying with us.  I appreciate your feedback on your stay.  I am sorry you encountered the housekeeping issues.  I have addressed the issues with the staff. If you should have the opportunity to come to New Orleans again, please give us another try.
Again, thank you for staying with us while you were in New Orleans.
Regards,
owner_response.title: Owner Response
